intro: Trigonella grossheimii, commonly known as the Jordanian fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small yellow flowers. The plant produces slender, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Trigonella grossheimii is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological and agricultural studies.
